page.title: 15Public Services
page.content: Most of the section has water from Wessex Water(a few from S.W.Water by a new pipeline). Sewerage and Environ- mental Rates are paid to S.W.W.A. Some farms and other dwellings have their own spring or well-water supplies. Many more have their own septic tanks instead of main drainage. Most farms and houses have elec- tricity from S.W.E.B. mains, but a few generate their own. CEGB pylons are a feature of the landscape. There is no mains gas supply, but considerable use of cylinder gas. The telephone is essential in such an area-only about 6 dwellings are without one.There is no public tele- phone.In Brushford there are 2 daily postal deliveries; in the outlying areas, one.The Postman is usually willing to collect mail.
